intro: Tetrapterys kohautii, commonly known as the Mexican velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Tetrapterys kohautii is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
